commit_message:
DVR: Create separate routing table for routers in fip namespace

The fip namespace is shared between tenants on a given compute node.
So far the fip namespace was only used for forwarding floatingip
traffic, but with the fast-path exit, this namespace will also be
used for forwarding the traffic directly to the external network
without floating IPs if the address scopes match.

In order to provide flexibility in adding the different next hop
routes for the external network, each router will now have a dedicated
table that hosts the routing rules.

The traffic is matched based on the incoming interface and forwarded
to the route lookup table.

The table index is generated from the fpr-interface ip so it should
be unique on a given node.

Change-Id: I5c46ab99d0b9482a2a2012d2e5abb7f293ae4f36

commit_message:
Implement subgraph (aka start/end) execution

Pass through subgraphs list for Astute execution.

The format is a list of subgraphs with start/end.
The option is passed as-is to Astute.

Change-Id: I5c705076adcce4e47a62edc30d3d5a191f5ec813
Closes-bug: #1612616

commit_message:
Collect IPA logs

Change-Id: I4a2ccbe00333c1c9438a4ac4b7fa627cf4d9571b
Partial-bug: #1526301
Co-Authored-By: IWAMOTO Toshihiro <iwamoto@valinux.co.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/69/275569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======== IPA Logs ======== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526301 This spec proposes to add support for collecting IPA logs to Ironic, which will help with troubleshooting and error reporting. Problem description =================== Currently the IPA logs are silently discarded, which makes troubleshooting failed deployments very difficult. Setting up a serial console for deploy kernels can improve the situation a bit, but is still clumsy to use. Proposed change =============== Add new fields to the IPA heartbeat JSON and incrementally send logs and kernel dmesgs with heartbeat messages. Change the IPA to initialize its loglevel from the ipa-loglevel agent parameter. On the Ironic side, a new config variable logging_enabled is added to the agent section. The obtained logs from agents are written to Ironic logs when specified in the config variable. Log lines will be prefixed to distinguish agent logs and dmesgs from ordinary logs. Agent logs will be logged at the INFO level, while dmesg will be logged at the DEBUG level. Alternatives ------------ The following alternative was originally proposed. You cannot get the log data until a deploy finishes. But it is simpler and might be good enough if we don't consider long-running IPAs. Create new REST resources on the IPA that gives agent logs. On the Ironic side, the agent deploy code obtains the agent logs using the REST resource when a deploy is finished. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- The Ironic API's drivers' vendor_passthru/lookup will return a response body with a new logging_enabled key. For example:: {'heartbeat_timeout': 300, 'logging_enabled': ['agent', 'dmesg'], 'node': 'abcdef-1234-5678-0123'} If the logging_enabled attribute is true, an IPA API heartbeat message will look like:: {'agent_url': ..., 'logs': {'dmesg': ..., 'agent': ...}} Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None. The REST API change only affects IPAs. RPC API impact -------------- IPA logs will be passed over the RPC API to the Conductor, if these are large, they will affect the RPC bus. Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- Anyone on the IPA network might be eavesdropping agent logs and kernel messages. This shouldn't cause any security impact as the network is supposed to be a trusted network. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ As dmesgs can be large, dmesg logging can consume network bandwidth or Ironic server's resources when enabled. Other deployer impact --------------------- As written in the Proposed changes section, the new config variable logging_enabled is added, which takes a list value with the following default value:: [agent] logging_enabled = agent Deployers can explicitly turn off agent logging or add "dmesg" to there. Deployers may choose to increase log verbosity on IPAs in order to get more information using the new ipa-loglevel agent parameter. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: niu-zglinux Work Items ---------- * Add log fields to the IPA heartbeat messages * Add logging code to the agent deploy driver Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be added on the Ironic side. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== When only one of an Ironic server and an IPA supports this feature and the other doesn't, this feature is simply unavailable and no incompatibility errors will be generated. Documentation Impact ==================== The new config options will be documented. References ========== * Another approach to troubleshooting by disabling power off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/172932

commit_message:
Collapse devmode definitions on release file

Collapsing devmode definitions on config file and removing release file
created side effect when scripts and defaults expected to find a release
definitions.
This patch moves all devmode definitions on the release file instread,
removing the need to specify devmode.yml as extra configuration file.

Change-Id: Id651f90b0c28f9aa402eb6f78713bc22633ad88c

subject: Convert to unicode explicitly to avoid UnicodeDecodeError
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 07:49:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard/commit/ca729e7b16e3bb9cdb02956cadcf4ab65e7dbbc1', 'message': "Convert unicode to str to avoid UnicodeDecodeError when updating plugin in a zh-cn environment with horizon

In a zh-cn environment in horizon, when click the button of updating plugin, chinese characters can lead to error.
Because the type of 'name' is unicode and chinese characters is out of 128 but the default encoding of python is ascii.
So we should convert 'name' to a str string for avoiding using unicode to encode.

Change-Id: I75f3334f7e6bac9dc2819ac2632636ece95efc31
Closes-Bug:#1622864
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-13 08:39:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard/commit/db72528ade72708bbadb9b84641b80f9a7b7d443', 'message': "Convert unicode to str to avoid UnicodeDecodeError

Python will decode 'prefix_trans' firstly. If 'prefix_trans' contains

So we convert 'prefix_trans' to unicode explicitly and python will not
decode because both 'prefix_trans' and 'name' is unicode. In fact,

commit_message:
Convert to unicode explicitly to avoid UnicodeDecodeError

In a zh-cn environment in horizon, when click the button of updating
plugin, chinese characters can lead to error.
Because the type of 'prefix_trans' is non unicode but 'name' is unicode.
Python will decode 'prefix_trans' firstly. If 'prefix_trans' contains
chinese characters then will lead to errors saying out of range 128.
So we convert 'prefix_trans' to unicode explicitly and python will not
decode because both 'prefix_trans' and 'name' is unicode. In fact,
'prefix_trans', 'prefix' and 'name' will be unicode at last.

Change-Id: I75f3334f7e6bac9dc2819ac2632636ece95efc31
Closes-Bug:#1622864

subject: Infoblox backend:Fixed sslverify value from option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 03:38:54.000000000', 'files': ['designate/backend/impl_infoblox/connector.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/19fec582ca7e4060f6e4f2f93c53492a0b9e6820', 'message': 'Infoblox backend:Fixed sslverify value from option

Infoblox connector always passes sslverify value with value True if we
set sslverify False in pools.yaml file . Since connector module
assumes it is empty value and  it goes to getattr function and set the
attributes for sslverify as True after reading from config file which
is default value.

Eventually connector sends the wrong configuration of sslverify to
python requests module and hence the exception occurred.

commit_message:
Infoblox backend:Fixed sslverify value from option

Infoblox connector always passes sslverify value with value True if we
set sslverify False in pools.yaml file . Since connector module
assumes it is empty value and  it goes to getattr function and set the
attributes for sslverify as True after reading from config file which
is default value.

Eventually connector sends the wrong configuration of sslverify to
python requests module and hence the exception occurred.

Change-Id: I903254ec4aa8f6e0230c78ed7b22aab0e0326190
Closes-Bug: #1618688
Closes-Bug: #1620462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/33/369133/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import strutils if opt == 'sslverify': # NOTE(selvakumar): This check is for sslverify option. # type of sslverify is unicode string from designate DB # if the value is 0 getattr called for setting default values. # to avoid setting default values we use oslo strutils if not strutils.is_int_like(options.get(opt)): option_value = options.get(opt) else: option_value = strutils.bool_from_string(options.get(opt), default=True) setattr(self, opt, option_value) continue

in properties groups.

commit_message:
Add properties groups schema for Resource

Add PropertiesGroups with validating for each
group in it and properties_groups_schema to Resource
class for further using in resource plugins.

implements bp heat-property-group

Change-Id: I057552a6ef89220a191995b5f1ed9f71bcd123c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/340459/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine import properties_groups def test_correct_properties_groups_validate(self): tmpl = template.Template({ 'HeatTemplateFormatVersion': '2012-12-12', 'Resources': { 'foo': {'Type': 'ResourceWithPropsType', 'Properties': {'Foo': 'test', 'FooInt': 2}}, } }) stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl) res = stack['foo'] res.properties_groups_schema = { 'group1': properties_groups.Schema( ['Foo', 'FooInt'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) } res.properties_groups = properties_groups.PropertiesGroups( res.properties_groups_schema, res.properties) self.assertIsNone(res.validate()) def test_properties_groups_invalid(self): tmpl = template.Template({ 'HeatTemplateFormatVersion': '2012-12-12', 'Resources': { 'foo': {'Type': 'ResourceWithPropsType', 'Properties': {'Foo': 'test', 'FooInt': 2}}, } }) stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl) res = stack['foo'] res.properties_groups_schema = { 'group1': properties_groups.Schema( ['Foo', 'FooInt'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.XOR ) } res.properties_groups = properties_groups.PropertiesGroups( res.properties_groups_schema, res.properties) ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, res.validate) self.assertEqual('Properties group error: Resources.foo.Properties: ' 'Cannot define the following properties at the same ' 'time: Foo, FooInt.', six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Add operators for properties group

Add operators and corresponding solvers for them
to PropertiesGroup.

implements bp heat-property-group

Change-Id: I33f89999be93e8bbb15e47c9b66878f71e62bc27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/11/338211/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'operator': 'and', schema = properties_groups.Schema(['a', 'b'], operator='and') 'operator': 'and', schema = properties_groups.Schema('a', operator='and') operator='and', operator='and', message="c is incorrect. operator should be in list of " "allowed operators: ('and', 'or', 'xor')")), operator='and' self.assertEqual('and', group.operator()) def test_properties_solver_and(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'b'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') self.assertEqual(True, group.solver_and(True, True)) self.assertEqual(False, group.solver_and(True, False)) def test_properties_solver_or(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'b'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.OR ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') self.assertEqual(True, group.solver_or(True, True)) self.assertEqual(True, group.solver_or(True, False)) def test_properties_solver_xor(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'b'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.XOR ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') self.assertEqual(False, group.solver_xor(True, True)) self.assertEqual(True, group.solver_xor(True, False)) self.assertEqual(True, group.solver_xor(False, True)) self.assertEqual(False, group.solver_xor(False, False)) def test_properties_solve_operator(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'b'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') self.assertEqual(True, group.solve_operator(None, 'a', group.solver_or)) self.assertEqual(True, group.solve_operator(True, None, group.solver_xor)) self.assertEqual(True, group.solve_operator([], 'a', group.solver_xor)) self.assertEqual(False, group.solve_operator(None, True, group.solver_and)) self.assertEqual(False, group.solve_operator([], {}, group.solver_or)) def test_group_solution_simple_properties(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') data = {'a': 1, 'b': 'check', 'c': {'e': 'f'}, 'd': [0, 1, 2]} self.assertEqual(True, group.group_solution(data, {})) def test_group_solution_group_properties(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', 'group-1'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) subschema = properties_groups.Schema( ['b', 'c'], operator=properties_groups.Schema.XOR ) group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') subgroup = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(subschema, 'group-1') data = {'a': 1, 'b': 'check', 'c': None, 'd': [0, 1, 2]} self.assertEqual(True, group.group_solution(data, {'group-1': subgroup})) def test_group_solution_complex_properties(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', ['c', 'e'], ['d', 'g']], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) data = {'a': 1, 'b': 'check', 'c': {'e': 'f'}, 'd': [{'g': 'h'}, {'g': 'i'}]} group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') self.assertEqual(True, group.group_solution(data, {})) def test_group_solution_complex_invalid(self): schema = properties_groups.Schema( ['a', ['c', 'e'], ['d', 'g']], operator=properties_groups.Schema.AND ) data = {'a': 1, 'b': 'check', 'c': [{'e': 'f'}], 'd': [{'g': 'h'}, {'g': 'i'}]} group = properties_groups.PropertiesGroup(schema, 'test') ex = self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidSchemaError, group.group_solution, data, {}) self.assertEqual('Cannot group properties from different lists: c, d', six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Set permissions on the openstackgit directory

The change removes the constraint that would skip setting the directory
permissions in certain cases. Now permissions will be recursively set
and the task will follow symlinks should it encounter any at the provided
path.

This should solve permission related issues on playbook reruns and the
permissions will always be correctly set by the role.

Change-Id: I3d974d578f3e2323415e36c40efa48036b517468
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add check for swift_hash_path_ variables

We should never change the swift_hash_path_prefix/suffix variables on a
running cluster. This PR implements a check that will fail if the
variable is different to what is already on disk.

To ensure this is still possible this PR implements a
"swift_force_change_hashes" variable which can be set to "True" in order
to force change the swift_hash_path variables regardless of whether they
are different or not.

Change-Id: Idaedc125aede22c347668afd9e98ed1823eb142c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/53/369353/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Specify which type of config we are using for the deployment

In some case, ansible needs to know which type of config we are
running. It's avoid to use some tricks for counting the number
of compute or controller nodes (for example).

Change-Id: I4348b114bea96b238b619a83f84c6a12105f84f5

commit_message:
fix port address allocation for auto-addr subnet

AutomaticAddressRequest is created manually in
add_auto_addr_on_network_ports.
But expected workkflow is to use address request factory, that can be
overriden by ipam driver to deliver custom AddressRequest classes.
Added code to follow expected workflow.
Now factory method called for SLAAC allocations, so third party ipam
driver can deliver custom AddressRequest for these allocations.

Change-Id: I95d6097a6bc30107e2819c484e9718f6a5ee619e
Closes-Bug: 1570465

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton

This allows the database to be upgraded with the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade newton

Also clean up a deprecated use of model_base because the
deprecation warning was cluttering up the output of
neutron-db-manage.

Depends-On: I5b9c02814bdc1945422184a84c49f9e67dcf24a9

commit_message:
Use rpc_notifier driver for notifications

list_notifier was deprecated a very long time ago so
all versions since Icehouse should use the
rpc_notifier.

Also removed unnecessary amulet test that is causing
race conditions.

Change-Id: I44a2e6f2cc98f58373eddc50aa0dea268e94c753
Closes-Bug: 1620564

commit_message:
Prevent galera_cluster_name from changing.

On a running galera cluster, we don't want to unintentionally allow a
galera_cluster_name from changing. This will cause a cluster to fail to
start (if the nodes are restarted sequentially) as the cluter name value
has changed.

To ensure we can still change this value, a new
"galera_force_change_cluster_name" variable is added, which can be set
to "True" in order to change the cluster name.

Change-Id: I8bae038bd207a15d5731b9c91b78df851a4c1986
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/47/369547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This variable will prevent the galera_cluster_name from changing unintentionally on a running cluster. # To intentionally change the galera_cluster_name set this variable to True galera_force_change_cluster_name: False

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton

This allows the database to be upgraded with the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade newton

Migration f399fa0f5f25 is the newton milestone for the expand
branch. It was tagged earlier (although it shouldn't have been).

Migration 61cc795e43e8 was erroneously tagged, so remove the
tag from there.

Also clean up a deprecated use of model_base because the
deprecation warning was cluttering up the output of
neutron-db-manage.

Depends-On: I5b9c02814bdc1945422184a84c49f9e67dcf24a9

Partial-Bug: #1623108

Change-Id: If1820978c1eb6a8c2dbff20b349c0d4108a49258

commit_message:
Zero tolerance for errors on nodes as default behavior

Without this change we do not mark deployment as error
if task on node failed.

Also use early initialize of logger for support library
Deployment

Change-Id: Ibcac4569756b34c3c1ac33f68ae203246d94d2a4
Closes-Bug: #1620858

commit_message:
Use memory mode for sqlite in db test

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated in
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and deprecate argumentsqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use config option
connection instead. For watcher, we test database with sqlite in memory
mode [1] as below:

cfg.CONF.set_override("connection", "sqlite://",
                      group="database", enforce_type=True)

and don't use config option sqlite_db, so remove unused code.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

Change-Id: I9b1f995e1b7004bcfe6c5a854c2f83b24e5bfb56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/68/367968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton

This allows the database to be upgraded with the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade newton

Depends-On: I5b9c02814bdc1945422184a84c49f9e67dcf24a9

Closes-Bug: #1623108

Change-Id: I91931c958e33c57515818e7f2d099f02783d6102

commit_message:
Use fernet tokens in vnc

Use fernet tokens as access tokens in nova console auth
for authentication.

Change-Id: Iee3540ec67e66236ce2ebacca2e90211ac0873af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/320453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================== Use fernet tokens for vnc console in HA ======================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/fernet-tokens-for-vnc Add ability to share tokens for vnc among controller nodes in HA. Problem description =================== In HA mode tokens for vnc console are not shared actually. So user needs to reload page several times until it will be pointed to correct node with this token. Use Cases --------- What use cases does this address? What impact on actors does this change have? Ensure you are clear about the actors in each use case: Developer, End User, Deployer etc. Proposed change =============== Use fernet tokens instead of uuid that are currently issued by nova compute. Usage of fernet tokens will allow to authenticate tokens on any controller node in high available configuration. It doesn't need to share tokens between controller. Alternatives ------------ Use distributed cache for storing vnc access tokens to share it among controllers. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Performance can subtly degrade due to overhead on encryption and decryption during authorizing token. But this won't affect performance very much because vnc in not used very often. Other deployer impact --------------------- In case of high available deployment keystone should be configured with fernet token provider. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: gstepanov Other contributors: tdurakov Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Deploy openstack in high available configuration, check that vnc console in horizon work properly even after a few page reloads (case when request is sent to another controller). Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

subject: libvirt: fix live-migration with serial console check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 17:03:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ec94d7bab88d93450e31a7117ac135439dc9eed4', 'message': 'libvirt: fix live-migration with serial console check

If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled and the serial console
is enabled, the live-migration of an instance will result in an ERROR state.
This is due to the move in commit 917afd2831b. The "can migrate" verification
from the late "_live_migration_operation" step to the earlier
"check_can_live_migrate_source" step . The "listen_addr" variable will then
always be None, and the check for the serial console in
"_verify_serial_console_is_disabled" will then be a false negative.

This change adds the "serial_listen_addr" to the migration_data object
in the "check_can_live_migrate_destination" step, so that the step
"check_can_live_migrate_source" can access it and make a decision based
on that.

Closes-Bug: 1595962
Change-Id: I94fad08a31bc1d90c95c13f34fe4e9b74e0920ac

commit_message:
libvirt: fix live-migration with serial console check

If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled and the serial console
is enabled, the live-migration of an instance will result in an ERROR state.
This is due to the move in commit 917afd2831b. The "can migrate" verification
from the late "_live_migration_operation" step to the earlier
"check_can_live_migrate_source" step . The "listen_addr" variable will then
always be None, and the check for the serial console in
"_verify_serial_console_is_disabled" will then be a false negative.

This change adds the "serial_listen_addr" to the migration_data object
in the "check_can_live_migrate_destination" step, so that the step
"check_can_live_migrate_source" can access it and make a decision based
on that.

Closes-Bug: 1595962
Change-Id: I94fad08a31bc1d90c95c13f34fe4e9b74e0920ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/335132/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(objects.Service, 'get_by_compute_host') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_create_shared_storage_test_file', return_value="file") @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_compare_cpu') def test_check_can_live_migrate_dest_provides_serial_listen_addr( self, mock_cpu, mock_test_file, mock_svc): instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) instance_ref.vcpu_model = test_vcpu_model.fake_vcpumodel drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) self.flags(enabled=True, group="serial_console") self.flags(proxyclient_address="192.168.5.6", group="serial_console") compute_info = {'disk_available_least': 400, 'cpu_info': 'asdf'} data = drvr.check_can_live_migrate_destination(self.context, instance_ref, None, compute_info, False) self.assertEqual(data.serial_listen_addr, "192.168.5.6") @mock.patch.object(fakelibvirt, 'VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE', True, self.flags(enabled=False, group="vnc") self.flags(enabled=False, group="spice")

commit_message:
Use parameters instead of config for workload stabilization

This patch set allows to use audit parameters for
workload-stabilization strategy and makes some little
refactoring.

Closes-Bug: #1620604
Change-Id: I60e34611d4dd001beed31666fd11d2ab11c1723c

commit_message:
Message correction on cli for Delete VNF call

When the user issues a vnf-delete command, it gives output message
as 'Deleted vnf: <vnf id>'. With the new behavior of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291032/ , output message should
be like 'Request to delete VNF <vnf id> has been accepted'

Closes-bug: #1573194
depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291032/
Change-Id: Ibd1912ce1600804dee04dba79561ee5c0c12be7a

commit_message:
Introduce proposal jobs for ironic-python-agent CoreOS version

Currently, the CoreOS version is pinned in the ironic-python-agent
repository. This requires manual commits in the repository for any
update to happen. This approach was prefered instead of building from
latest at all times to prevent a CoreOS release from breaking our gates.

This commit introduces a proposal job to bump the CoreOS version. It
does so by leveraging the existing proposal scripts to submit changes
for new CoreOS versions as they become available. This approach allows
us to gate new CoreOS releases so they do not impact us, and allows us
to benefit from the latest updates.

Closes-bug: 1600228
Change-Id: Icf94aed2811912e46d7de1aa002903299122b3f7
Depends-on: I78cb2efff2293b1591b30b7e39df9fc2af98d0b2

commit_message:
Add non-voting python 3 tempest jobs

The change I3a1dfde76009cbac1d419e0ff3f1d20c4a2e99c3 tests
devstack with the python 3 switch flipped where we see
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full passing. The job currently
installs python clients/commands that are exercised in
devstack and services that have the python3.4
classifiers(currently Keystone and Neutron) to run using
python 3.  However, the changes mentioned in the below
depends on patch would have to be merged before see a
successful tempest run.

For a start, add tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-py3-nv jobs to
the integrated gate and tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-{name}-py3-nv
jobs to lib-forward-testing.

Depends-On: I4ca6366d4a4d1b007d12e7cd3975506e101d42c0

Change-Id: I9a086f5452a42667dd6b1575a57381402aca3726

commit_message:
Support nova_consoleauth and nova_novncproxy

Right now, nova_consoleauth and nova_novncproxy
can't be deployed by kolla-kubernetes.
This feature implements it.

Implements: blueprint nova-consoleauth-nova-novncproxy

Change-Id: I67d48e6309e150fe843160a84a1698bafe577132

commit_message:
Disable DNSSEC on jenkins slaves

Ubuntu has forced DNSSEC in unbound configuration, so if you have
private network with some private DNS-domain like "private.lan", then
unbound not resolves private hostnames.

Change-Id: Iae77a38d89cfadd56f86ae46c37642a6ec3f4ec7

subject: Add alias for OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-14 10:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openrc.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_openrc/commit/69ff7971eca5e63fb7a0a904db21a2597dd932c6', 'message': 'Add alias for OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE

Some service clients do not respect the old OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE
parameter, instead only supporting the newer fashion of
OS_INTERFACE which is viewed as less confusing. This adds support
for that option.

Failure to include this causes SSL certificate errors when the
service clients attempt to use the public endpoint with a self-
signed certificate on defaulted installs, particularly AIOs.

This error can be demonstrated by trying to use the Gnocchi or new
Aodh clients from a utility container, though only the Gnocchi
client is currently installed in the integrated build.

Change-Id: I60af4f0cf56964eaec8980264ec1ebadc550c0b8
(cherry picked from commit e14f1f39200d734d01361fafa667c8dc19096ce3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add alias for OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE

Some service clients do not respect the old OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE
parameter, instead only supporting the newer fashion of
OS_INTERFACE which is viewed as less confusing. This adds support
for that option.

Failure to include this causes SSL certificate errors when the
service clients attempt to use the public endpoint with a self-
signed certificate on defaulted installs, particularly AIOs.

This error can be demonstrated by trying to use the Gnocchi or new
Aodh clients from a utility container, though only the Gnocchi
client is currently installed in the integrated build.

Change-Id: I60af4f0cf56964eaec8980264ec1ebadc550c0b8
(cherry picked from commit e14f1f39200d734d01361fafa667c8dc19096ce3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_openrc refs/changes/09/370009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export OS_INTERFACE={{ openrc_os_endpoint_type }}

commit_message:
Change image type to RAW in osic-cloud8

Since we run ceph backend, having RAW image is much better for
performance as instead of copying data Ceph handles CoW shapshots

Change-Id: I4c838e8ed850a57c19697ab472840b4ba69c94f5

commit_message:
Add extras and pytz>=2013.6 into test requirements

These two modules are seemingly installed in ubuntu 16 and Fedora
systems. Ubuntu 14 needs them to be included explicitly.

Change-Id: I3e56453c36be20b160ba61a26015ec8ed0fa02a4
Closes-bug: 1623308

commit_message:
Configure admin NIC prior the first system boot

Having admin NIC confugured in the middle of system booting
is very fragile and error-prone approach.
It's better to configure it ahead of first booting time.

Also, there's no need for freaky networking restarting inside of
cloud-init boothooks anymore.

Change-Id: I4c278341e8b40eb8d9b100bed1d9a650f27b5c5b
Related-Bug: #1583815

Just a temporary fix to avoid dealing with cloud-init # boothooks. provision.configure_admin_nic( chroot=chroot, iface=self.driver.configdrive_scheme.common.admin_iface_name, ip=self.driver.configdrive_scheme.common.admin_ip, netmask=self.driver.configdrive_scheme.common.admin_mask, gw=self.driver.configdrive_scheme.common.gw)
deleted_lines:
# FIXME(agordeev) There's no convenient way to perfrom NIC # remapping in Ubuntu, so injecting files prior the first boot # should work with open(chroot + '/etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules', 'wt', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(u'# Generated by fuel-agent during provisioning: ' u'BEGIN
') # pattern is aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff_eth0,aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff_eth1 for mapping in self.driver.configdrive_scheme. \ common.udevrules.split(','): mac_addr, nic_name = mapping.split('_') f.write(u'SUBSYSTEM=="net", ACTION=="add", DRIVERS=="?*", ' u'ATTR{address}=="%s", ATTR{type}=="1", ' u'KERNEL=="eth*", NAME="%s"
' % (mac_addr, nic_name)) f.write( u'# Generated by fuel-agent during provisioning: END
') # FIXME(agordeev): Disable net-generator that will add new etries # to 70-persistent-net.rules with open(chroot + '/etc/udev/rules.d/' '75-persistent-net-generator.rules', 'wt', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(u'# Generated by fuel-agent during provisioning:
' u'# DO NOT DELETE. It is needed to disable ' u'net-generator
')

subject: Add the database v1 to v2 migration script in tools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:24:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/a80d9f09505ffaa70e3df2863001d75537cd77ad', 'message': 'Add the database migripation scripts in tools

Steps to run the script
1.create 2 nova instances on private network
2.add secgroup rule to allow ssh etc
3.ssh into nova instance and run this if you want a very simple web server
4.create lb pool1 on pirvate subnet
5.create 2 lb members on pool1
6.create lb vip load balancing pool1 and vip address on private-subnet
7.Create a Healthmonitor and associated it with  pool1
8. Direct to /neutron-lbaas/neutron_lbaas/db/migration
9. Create a revision file
3. Edit the created file and fill the content properly with this file
4. Run alembic upgrade head
5. Stop v1 neutron service and v1  lbaas agent
6. Change Neutron.conf and Neutron_lbaas.conf for v2
7. Restart v2 neutron service and v2 lbaas agent
8. Run the migration upgrade code
9. Check the database table to confirm the migration is all set

Change-Id: I57201f1cbc32af699e91709f5a28002670f20b03

commit_message:
Add the database v1 to v2 migration script in tools

The database migration code and steps to run the script are all
described in the file.

Change-Id: I57201f1cbc32af699e91709f5a28002670f20b03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/95/289595/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """migrate database table from v1 to v2 Revision ID: 24763a808465 Revises: Create Date: 2015-06-03 14:54:10.348671 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. # revision = depdens on the db migration version # down_revision = None branch_labels = None depends_on = None from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from oslo_utils import uuidutils listener_protocols = sa.Enum("HTTP", "HTTPS", "TCP", name="listener_protocolsv2") pool_protocols = sa.Enum("HTTP", "HTTPS", "TCP", name="pool_protocolsv2") sesssionpersistences_type = sa.Enum("SOURCE_IP", "HTTP_COOKIE", "APP_COOKIE", name="sesssionpersistences_typev2") lb_algorithms = sa.Enum("ROUND_ROBIN", "LEAST_CONNECTIONS", "SOURCE_IP", name="lb_algorithmsv2") pools_type = sa.Enum("PING", "TCP", "HTTP", "HTTPS", name="pools_typev2") healthmonitors_type = sa.Enum("PING", "TCP", "HTTP", "HTTPS", name="healthmonitors_typev2") lbaas_pools = sa.Table('lbaas_pools', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column('id', sa.Integer()), sa.Column('tenant_id', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column('name', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column('description', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column('protocol', pool_protocols, nullable=False), sa.Column('lb_algorithm', lb_algorithms, nullable=False), sa.Column('healthmonitor_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column('provisioning_status', sa.String(16), nullable=False), sa.Column('operating_status', sa.String(16), nullable=False), sa.Column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id'), sa.UniqueConstraint(u'healthmonitor_id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'healthmonitor_id'], [u'lbaas_healthmonitors.id']) ) lbaas_healthmonitors = sa.Table('lbaas_healthmonitors', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column('id', sa.Integer()), sa.Column('tenant_id', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column('type', healthmonitors_type, nullable=False), sa.Column('delay', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column('timeout', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column('max_retries', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column('http_method', sa.String(16), nullable=True), sa.Column('url_path', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column('expected_codes', sa.String(64), nullable=True), sa.Column('provisioning_status', sa.String(64), nullable=True), sa.Column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id') ) lbaas_members = sa.Table('lbaas_members', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'tenant_id', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'pool_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'subnet_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'address', sa.String(64), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'protocol_port', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'weight', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'provisioning_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'operating_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'admin_state_up', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'pool_id'], [u'lbaas_pools.id']), sa.UniqueConstraint(u'pool_id', u'address', u'protocol_port', name=u'uniq_pool_address_port_v2') ) lbaas_loadbalancers = sa.Table('lbaas_loadbalancers', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'tenant_id', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'name', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'description', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'vip_port_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'vip_subnet_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'vip_address', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'admin_state_up', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'provisioning_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'operating_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'vip_port_id'], [u'ports.id'],name=u'fk_lbaas_loadbalancers_ports_id'), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id') ) lbaas_sessionpersistences = sa.Table('lbaas_sessionpersistences', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'pool_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'type', sesssionpersistences_type, nullable=False), sa.Column(u'cookie_name', sa.String(1024), nullable=True), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'pool_id'], [ u'lbaas_pools.id']), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'pool_id') ) lbaas_loadbalanceragentbindings = sa.Table('lbaas_loadbalanceragentbindings', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'loadbalancer_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'agent_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint( [u'loadbalancer_id'], [u'lbaas_loadbalancers.id'], ondelete="CASCADE"), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint( [u'agent_id'], [u'agents.id'], ondelete="CASCADE"), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint( u'loadbalancer_id') ) lbaas_loadbalancer_statistics = sa.Table('lbaas_loadbalancer_statistics', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'loadbalancer_id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'bytes_in', sa.BigInteger(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'bytes_out', sa.BigInteger(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'active_connections', sa.BigInteger(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'total_connections', sa.BigInteger(), nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint( u'loadbalancer_id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint( [u'loadbalancer_id'], [u'lbaas_loadbalancers.id']) ) lbaas_listeners = sa.Table('lbaas_listeners', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'tenant_id', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'name', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'description', sa.String(255), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'protocol', listener_protocols, nullable=False), sa.Column(u'protocol_port', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'connection_limit', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'loadbalancer_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'default_pool_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'status', sa.String(16), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'admin_state_up', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'provisioning_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'operating_status', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'default_tls_container_id', sa.String(128), nullable=False), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'loadbalancer_id'], [u'lbaas_loadbalancers.id']), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'default_pool_id'], [u'lbaas_pools.id']), sa.UniqueConstraint(u'default_pool_id'), sa.UniqueConstraint(u'loadbalancer_id', u'protocol_port', name=u'uniq_loadbalancer_listener_port'), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id') ) providerresourceassociations = sa.Table('providerresourceassociations', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column(u'provider_name',sa.String(255),nullable=False), sa.Column(u'resource_id',sa.String(36),nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'provider_name',u'resource_id'), sa.UniqueConstraint(u'resource_id') ) def upgrade(): connection = op.get_bind() # describe the part of the pools table we will query. pools = sa.sql.table('pools', sa.sql.column('id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('tenant_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('name', sa.String), sa.sql.column('description', sa.String), sa.sql.column('protocol', pool_protocols), sa.sql.column('lb_method', lb_algorithms), sa.sql.column('status', sa.String), sa.sql.column('vip_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('subnet_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean) ) # describe the part of the healthmonitors table we will query. healthmonitors = sa.sql.table('healthmonitors', sa.sql.column('id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('tenant_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('type', healthmonitors_type), sa.sql.column('delay', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('timeout', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('max_retries', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('http_method', sa.String), sa.sql.column('url_path', sa.String), sa.sql.column('expected_codes', sa.String), sa.sql.column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean) ) # describe the part of the poolmonitorassociations table we will query. poolmonitorassociations = sa.sql.table('poolmonitorassociations', sa.sql.column('status', sa.String), sa.sql.column('pool_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('monitor_id', sa.String) ) # describe the part of the members table we will query. members = sa.sql.table('members', sa.sql.column('id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('tenant_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('status', sa.String), sa.sql.column('status_description', sa.String), sa.sql.column('pool_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('address', sa.String), sa.sql.column('protocol_port', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('weight', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean) ) # describe the part of the loadbalancer table we will query. vips = sa.sql.table('vips', sa.sql.column('id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('tenant_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('status', sa.String), sa.sql.column('status_description', sa.String), sa.sql.column('name', sa.String), sa.sql.column('description', sa.String), sa.sql.column('port_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('protocol_port', sa.Integer), sa.sql.column('protocol', pool_protocols), sa.sql.column('pool_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('admin_state_up', sa.Boolean), sa.sql.column('connection_limit', sa.Integer) ) # describe the part of the ipallocations table we will query. ipallocations = sa.sql.table('ipallocations', sa.sql.column('port_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('ip_address', sa.String), sa.sql.column('subnet_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('network_id', sa.String), ) # describe the part of the sessionpersistences table we will query. sessionpersistences = sa.sql.table('sessionpersistences', sa.sql.column('vip_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('type', sesssionpersistences_type), sa.sql.column('cookie_name', sa.String), ) # describe the part of the poolstatisticss table we will query poolstatisticss = sa.sql.table('poolstatisticss', sa.sql.column('pool_id', sa.String), sa.sql.column('bytes_in', sa.BigInteger), sa.sql.column('bytes_out', sa.BigInteger), sa.sql.column('active_connections', sa.BigInteger), sa.sql.column('total_connections', sa.BigInteger) ) sql_listeners = "select vips.tenant_id,vips.id,vips.name," \ "vips.description,vips.protocol,vips.protocol_port," \ "vips.connection_limit,lbaas_loadbalancers.id AS " \ "loadbalancer_id,vips.pool_id AS default_pool_id," \ "vips.admin_state_up," \ "lbaas_loadbalancers.provisioning_status AS " \ "provisioning_status,lbaas_loadbalancers.operating_status " \ "AS operating_status from vips join lbaas_loadbalancers " \ "on vips.port_id = lbaas_loadbalancers.vip_port_id where provisioning_status='ACTIVE';" # check if we can migrate pools table or not, when its related # healthmonitors are more than two, we will not move and return msg. sql_validate_pool = "select count(tenant_id) from healthmonitors " \ "where tenant_id =(select tenant_id from pools)" result = connection.execute(sql_validate_pool) flag = True for row in result: if row[0] > 1: flag = False downgrade() break if flag: print("we can upgrade datatables for v2!") # Execute the query and insert the results into the # 'lb_healthmonitors'table. sqlstr_hm = "select healthmonitors.id,healthmonitors.tenant_id," \ "healthmonitors.type,healthmonitors.delay, " \ "healthmonitors.timeout,healthmonitors.max_retries, " \ "healthmonitors.http_method,healthmonitors.url_path," \ "healthmonitors.expected_codes," \ "healthmonitors.admin_state_up," \ "poolmonitorassociations.status AS provisioning_status " \ "from healthmonitors join poolmonitorassociations on " \ "poolmonitorassociations.monitor_id = healthmonitors.id where poolmonitorassociations.status='ACTIVE' " r_hm = connection.execute(sqlstr_hm) for row in r_hm: connection.execute(lbaas_healthmonitors.insert().values( id=row.id, tenant_id=row.tenant_id, type=row.type, delay=row.delay, timeout=row.timeout, max_retries=row.max_retries, http_method=row.http_method, url_path=row.url_path, expected_codes=row.expected_codes, provisioning_status=row.provisioning_status, admin_state_up=row.admin_state_up) ) r_hm.close() # move table pools sqlstr_pools = "select pools.id,pools.tenant_id,pools.name," \ "pools.description,pools.protocol," \ "pools.lb_method," \ "pools.status,pools.admin_state_up," \ "poolmonitorassociations.status AS " \ "provisioning_status," \ "poolmonitorassociations.monitor_id AS " \ "healthmonitor_id " \ "from pools join poolmonitorassociations on " \ "pools.id = poolmonitorassociations.pool_id where poolmonitorassociations.status='ACTIVE';" r_pool = connection.execute(sqlstr_pools) for row in r_pool: connection.execute(lbaas_pools.insert().values( id=row.id, tenant_id=row.tenant_id, name=row.name, description=row.description, protocol=row.protocol, lb_algorithm=row.lb_method, operating_status=row.status, provisioning_status=row.provisioning_status, healthmonitor_id=row.healthmonitor_id, admin_state_up=row.admin_state_up) ) r_pool.close() # move table members sqlstr_members = "select members.id, members.tenant_id," \ "members.status as operating_status, members.pool_id," \ "pools.subnet_id AS subnet_id,members.address," \ "members.protocol_port,members.weight," \ "members.admin_state_up,lbaas_pools.provisioning_" \ "status AS provisioning_status from members join " \ "lbaas_pools on members.pool_id = lbaas_pools.id " \ "join pools on pools.id=lbaas_pools.id where provisioning_status='ACTIVE';" r_member = connection.execute(sqlstr_members) for row in r_member: connection.execute(lbaas_members.insert().values( id=row.id, tenant_id=row.tenant_id, operating_status=row.operating_status, provisioning_status=row.provisioning_status, pool_id=row.pool_id, subnet_id=row.subnet_id, address=row.address, protocol_port=row.protocol_port, weight=row.weight, admin_state_up=row.admin_state_up) ) r_member.close() # move table load balancers sql_lb = "select vips.tenant_id,vips.name, vips.description," \ "vips.port_id AS vip_port_id,pools.subnet_id AS " \ "vip_subnet_id," \ "ipallocations.ip_address AS vip_address,vips.status, " \ "vips.admin_state_up from vips join pools on " \ "vips.pool_id = pools.id join ipallocations on " \ "pools.subnet_id = ipallocations.subnet_id and " \ "vips.port_id = ipallocations.port_id" r_lb = connection.execute(sql_lb) for row in r_lb: connection.execute(lbaas_loadbalancers.insert().values( id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), tenant_id=row.tenant_id, name=row.name, description=row.description, vip_port_id=row.vip_port_id, vip_subnet_id=row.vip_subnet_id, vip_address=row.vip_address, operating_status=row.status, provisioning_status='ONLINE', admin_state_up=row.admin_state_up) ) r_lb.close() sql_haproxy = "select id from lbaas_loadbalancers" r_haproxy = connection.execute(sql_haproxy) for row in r_haproxy: connection.execute(providerresourceassociations.insert().values( provider_name='haproxy', resource_id=row.id) ) r_haproxy.close() sql_sessionpersistences = "select vips.pool_id AS pool_id," \ "sessionpersistences.type," \ "sessionpersistences.cookie_name " \ "from sessionpersistences join vips on " \ "sessionpersistences.vip_id=vips.id" r_ss = connection.execute(sql_sessionpersistences) for row in r_ss: connection.execute(lbaas_sessionpersistences.insert().values( pool_id=row.pool_id, type=row.type, cookie_name=row.cookie_name) ) r_ss.close() sql_listeners = "select vips.tenant_id,vips.id,vips.name," \ "vips.description,vips.protocol,vips.protocol_port," \ "vips.connection_limit,lbaas_loadbalancers.id AS " \ "loadbalancer_id,vips.pool_id AS default_pool_id," \ "vips.admin_state_up," \ "lbaas_loadbalancers.provisioning_status AS " \ "provisioning_status,lbaas_loadbalancers.operating_status " \ "AS operating_status from vips join lbaas_loadbalancers " \ "on vips.port_id = lbaas_loadbalancers.vip_port_id where provisioning_status='ACTIVE';" r_listeners = connection.execute(sql_listeners) for row in r_listeners: connection.execute(lbaas_listeners.insert().values( tenant_id=row.tenant_id, id=row.id, name=row.name, description=row.description, protocol=row.protocol, protocol_port=row.protocol_port, connection_limit=row.connection_limit, loadbalancer_id=row.loadbalancer_id, default_pool_id=row.default_pool_id, admin_state_up=row.admin_state_up, provisioning_status=row.provisioning_status, operating_status=row.operating_status, default_tls_container_id=None) ) r_listeners.close() sql_poolloadbalanceragentbindings = "select lbaas_listeners.loadbalancer_id AS " \ "loadbalancer_id," \ "poolloadbalanceragentbindings.agent_id" \ " from poolloadbalanceragentbindings " \ "join lbaas_listeners on " \ "poolloadbalanceragentbindings.pool_id=lbaas_listeners.default_pool_id" r_poolbindings = connection.execute(sql_poolloadbalanceragentbindings) for row in r_poolbindings: connection.execute(lbaas_loadbalanceragentbindings.insert().values( loadbalancer_id=row.loadbalancer_id, agent_id=row.agent_id) ) r_poolbindings.close() sql_poolstatisticss = "select lbaas_listeners.loadbalancer_id AS loadbalancer_id," \ "poolstatisticss.bytes_in," \ "poolstatisticss.bytes_out," \ "poolstatisticss.active_connections," \ "poolstatisticss.total_connections " \ "from poolstatisticss " \ "join lbaas_listeners on " \ "poolstatisticss.pool_id=lbaas_listeners.default_pool_id" r_poolstatisticss = connection.execute(sql_poolstatisticss) for row in r_poolstatisticss: connection.execute(lbaas_loadbalancer_statistics.insert().values( loadbalancer_id=row.loadbalancer_id, bytes_in=row.bytes_in, bytes_out=row.bytes_out, active_connections=row.active_connections, total_connections=row.total_connections) ) r_poolstatisticss.close() else: print( "we cannot upgrade data tables due to multiple monitors linked with same pool") result.close() exit()

commit_message:
Ensure the nets, subnets and ports are present

This changes the tests to make sure everything is setup correctly.
It also outputs the available namespaces to make debugging easier,
because it was one of source of failures in the past.

Change-Id: I1d98ca4a7c4b3c8965a730f2df210809a5484b66
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/46/370046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensuring network is created correctly shell: | . /root/openrc neutron net-list | grep test-network register: neutron_net_list until: neutron_net_list.rc == 0 retries: 10 delay: 3 - name: Ensuring subnet is created correctly neutron subnet-list -c id -c name -f value | grep test-subnet register: neutron_subnet_list until: neutron_subnet_list.rc == 0 retries: 10 delay: 3 - name: Ensuring dhcp port is present shell: | . /root/openrc neutron port-list -c device_owner -c id -c fixed_ips -f value | egrep 'dhcp.*{{ neutron_subnet_list.stdout_lines[0].split(' ')[0] }}' register: neutron_port_list_dhcp until: neutron_port_list_dhcp.rc == 0 retries: 10 delay: 3 shell: ip netns ls- name: List the namespaces debug: msg: "{{ dhcp_namespace }}"
deleted_lines: - name: Create test port neutron port-create --name test-port test-network register: neutron_port_create until: neutron_port_create.rc == 0 retries: 5 delay: 10 shell: ip netns

commit_message:
Customize undercloud and overcloud with virt-customize

If undercloud and/or overcloud_customize_scripts are provided,
it will make customizations with virt-customize, so any extra tasks
needed can be performed there.

Change-Id: Ia5547c3e585e495c26a6f577477acc51774bdd6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/12/361112/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - when: overcloud_customize_script is defined block: - name: Create overcloud customize script template: src: "{{ overcloud_customize_script }}" dest: "{{ working_dir }}/overcloud-customize.sh" mode: 0755 # This allows to run a customization script on the # overcloud image, to cover any extra needs - name: Perform extra overcloud customizations command: > virt-customize -a {{ working_dir}}/overcloud-full.qcow2 --run '{{ working_dir}}/overcloud-customize.sh'

commit_message:
Update openstackclient commands

This updates the spec to reflect the changes that were done
during implementation of the osc commands. In particular:
- it was decided not to provide two commands (differing in
  spelling) for the same thing, so 'passthru' instead of
  'passthrough'
- not to implement osc commands that are equivalent to
  'ironic driver-raid-logical-disk-properties' and
   'ironic driver-properties' because we aren't sure (yet)
   what the "right" command might be

Change-Id: I1f146e73ea342f07d65dcc985a5e94f2c8a98fd0
Closes-Bug: #1526479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/21/363921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * only provide one OpenStackClient command to do something; avoid aliasing * for naming, the trend is to use Americanised spelling, eg 'favor' instead of 'favour'. Having said that, it is important to take into consideration the terminology/usage outside of OpenStack, e.g. by operators and administrators. --uuid <uuid> UUID of the chassis* openstack baremetal driver show <driver> * openstack baremetal driver passthru list <driver> * openstack baremetal driver passthru call <driver> <method> <method> Vendor passthru method to call. --arg <key=value> key=value to add to passthru method. Can be --fields <field,[field,...]> Select fields to fetch and display. --target-raid-config <config> Set the target RAID configuration (JSON) for the node. This can be one of: 1. a file containing JSON data of the RAID configuration; 2. "-" to read the contents from standard input; or 3. a valid JSON string. --name Name of the node. --target-raid_config target RAID configuration <method> Vendor passthru method to be called --arg <key=value> argument to send to passthru method. Can be specified multiple times. --http-method <http_method> One of 'POST', 'PUT', 'GET', 'DELETE', 'PATCH'ironic CLI users who want the equivalent to `ironic node-show-states` should use `openstack baremetal node show <node> --fields console_enabled last_error power_state provision_state provision_updated_at raid_config target_power_state target_provision_state target_raid_config`. Not addressed ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ OpenStackClient commands corresponding to these ironic CLI commands are not addressed by this proposal. They will be addressed in a future release. * `ironic driver-raid-logical-disk-properties`. Get RAID logical disk properties for a driver. * `ironic driver-properties`. Get properties (node.driver_info keys and descriptions) for a driver.
deleted_lines: * a small survey indicated that some people liked 'passthrough' and others liked 'thru'. Ironic's REST API and documentation use 'thru', whereas 'passthrough' is more "proper" English. To make everyone happy, we'll support both spellings.* openstack baremetal driver show <driver_name> --properties Only shows available driver properties * openstack baremetal driver passthrough list <driver_name> * openstack baremetal driver passthrough call <driver_name> <method> <method> Vendor passthrough method to call. --arg <key=value> key=value to add to passthrough method. Can be* openstack baremetal driver passthru list <driver_name> An alias to 'openstack baremetal driver passthrough list' * openstack baremetal driver passthru call <driver_name> <method> An alias to 'openstack baremetal driver passthrough call' --long Display detailed information about node. --states Include state information. Mutually exclusive with --long. * openstack baremetal node passthrough list <uuid> * openstack baremetal node passthrough call <uuid> <method> <method> Vendor-passthrough method to be called --arg <key=value> argument to send to passthrough method. Can be specified multiple times. --http-method <http_method> One of 'POST', 'PUT', 'GET', 'DELETE', 'PATCH' an alias to 'openstack baremetal node passthrough list' an alias to 'openstack baremetal node passthrough call'

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 07:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/0563961e6368664135f67f5504aa58f26b4b15ef', 'message': "Degrade failing identity-v3 job to experimental

failing constantly for more than a month now, see the related bug.

Trying to fix the issue has been unsuccessful so far, in particular
I haven't been able to reproduce the failure locally. So in order to

commit_message:
Degrade failing identity-v3 job to experimental

The job gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-nv seems to be
failing constantly for more than a month now, see the related bug.

Trying to fix the issue has been unsuccessful so far, in particular
I haven't been able to reproduce the failure locally. So in order to
conserve resources, make the job experimental until it can be fixed.

Change-Id: Ibed550fe615fc3a1ad4fb94e5e88f2ccafab0c90
Related-Bug: 1620999

commit_message:
Added tests on API hooks and related context

In this changeset, I raised the overall test coverage on the Watcher
API hooks.

Change-Id: I718030fdd23e83bf50d22b00828664adf66fc59d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/38/357938/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. commit_message:
When action plan is empty, its state is incorrect

When the action plan is empty,its state is still 'RECOMMENDED'.
I think it's should be 'SUCCEED'.
Closes-Bug: #1619155

Change-Id: Icd10707c7892089999f8b37775ca62bde47db0c4

subject: Upgrade a single package or a bunch of packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-14 08:25:59.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/upgrade/restart_services.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/override_pkg_version.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/getpackagegrouphash.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/be1e92804cf122f36735e2662bc360212d30eb0e', 'message': 'Upgrade a single package or a bunch of packages

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade
and override "ensure" parameter in package resource.
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded,
all the services in the same catalog should be restarted.

If there are no upgraded packages, then no services to be restarted.

Change-Id: Ic79cffb2b92cc0380261f5980263d84b7434a7f4
Closes-Bug: #1623038
Related-Bug: #1616553
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade a single package or a bunch of packages

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade
and override "ensure" parameter in package resource.
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded,
all the services in the same catalog should be restarted.

If there are no upgraded packages, then no services to be restarted.

Change-Id: Ic79cffb2b92cc0380261f5980263d84b7434a7f4
Closes-Bug: #1623038
Related-Bug: #1616553
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/05/369905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:getpackagegrouphash, :type => :rvalue, :doc => <<-'ENDHEREDOC') do |args| Return a hash with package names as keys and {ensure => "version of a package"} as values. The keys of input hash contain regular expressions which are used to match a list of installed packages. For example: Input: {"^.*apache2-[b,d].*$" => latest} Output: { apache2-bin => {ensure => latest}, apache2-data => {ensure => latest}, } ENDHEREDOC h = Hash.new() args[0].each {|key,value| grep_expr = "grep -Ew #{key}" case lookupvar('osfamily') when "Debian" p_list = `dpkg -l | grep -E "^[ a-z]{3}\s" | awk -F" " '{print $2}' | #{grep_expr}` when "RedHat" p_list = `rpm -qa | #{grep_expr}` end p_list.split("\n").each {|elem| h[elem] = value} } return h end end

subject: Fix race between setup-bootdev and network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 08:24:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/df97f112660b14c98882c0818a326265ab5aad21', 'message': 'Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-12 10:23:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/10db15151f2e16c05afd8da7f790010a8b16ecef', 'message': 'Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Closes-Bug: #1621468
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-12 14:47:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/338b37c90d33ff33b237ab85f3424197909d0706', 'message': 'Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Add systemd unit for setup-bootdev to controll ordering
of network and setup-bootdev services in CentOS bootstrap
image.

Change-Id: Iefa83096924259efbc4eb30359b9a19b3466e121
Closes-Bug: #1621468
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-12 15:14:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/6e75b6f38657dc09f8b38921fe651764d673b839', 'message': 'Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Redesign systemd units in the following way:
1) Move setup-bootdev unit from /etc to /usr and create symlink to /usr.
That prevents systemd to create unit from init.d script.
2) Add dependencies to setup-bootdev to run it before network.service.
3) Add fix-configs-on-startup unit and force to run it after
network-online target.
Now we have following well defined order: setup-bootdev -> network ->
-> fix-configs-on-startup ->(mcollective,ntp and other services)

commit_message:
Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Redesign systemd units in the following way:
1) Move setup-bootdev unit from /etc to /usr and create symlink to /etc.
That prevents systemd to create unit from init.d script.
2) Add dependencies to setup-bootdev to run it before network.service.
3) Add fix-configs-on-startup unit and force to run it after
network-online target.
Now we have following well defined order: setup-bootdev -> network ->
-> fix-configs-on-startup ->(mcollective,ntp and other services)

Change-Id: Iefa83096924259efbc4eb30359b9a19b3466e121
Closes-Bug: #1621468

commit_message:
Override PXE kernel cmdline via Glance property

Override PXE kernel cmdline via Glance property to allow images to boot
with a custom kernel command line. This is important because some images
requires different kernel command lines to identify which root filesystem
it needs to boot, for example, when booting from an LVM volume the root
filesystem should come from device mapper like "root=/dev/mapper/os-root".

This patch also allows Ironic to use this feature in the standalone mode,
if Glance is not available operators could set the custom kernel command
line to the node's instance_info['kernel_cmdline'] field directly and
that will be used when PXE booting the image.

Implements: blueprint override-pxe-options-via-glance-property
Co-Authored-By: Blake Caldwell <blakec@ornl.gov>
Change-Id: Icb070addf59c0ed62f2b2aac8fc597fdf8cf2a5a

commit_message:
Merge tag '3.2.0' into debian/newton

python-openstackclient 3.2.0 release

  [ gustavo panizzo ]
  * Add autopkgtest tests

  [ Corey Bryant ]
  * New usptream release.
  * Align (Build-)Depends with upstream.
  * d/p/0001-reproducible-build.patch: Dropped. Fixed upstream.

  [ Thomas Goirand ]
  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.

commit_message:
Update #noqa for out 79 character

Currently has some use # noqa because out 79 - character limit,
in order to conform the pep8 specification, I think we can make
some changes

Change-Id: Ia91ec8175521854e0b413441a2e05a23330aa8c3

commit_message:
Format the valid fields for list commands

When using list commands with 'fields' argument, the error info of
valid fields should contain both resource.fields and resource.labels.

The commands are:
chassis-list
chassis-node-list
node-list
node-port-list
port-list
chassis-show
node-show
port-show

Change-Id: Ie6c9a5cbf25c973f6ec3220017cd76df1da84eba
Closes-Bug: #1509191
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/41/245541/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if args.fields is not None: requested_fields = get_fields_by_labels(' '.join(args.fields[0]).split(',')) else: requested_fields = None def get_fields_by_labels(labels): """Get fields by labels. :param labels: A list of labels specified by the user. :returns: A list of fields corresponding to labels. """ valid_fields = [] for label in labels: valid_fields.append(label.lower().replace(' ', '_')) return valid_fields
deleted_lines: requested_fields = args.fields[0] if args.fields else None

commit_message:
Add dell switches support

This patch adds support of dell switches.
Has been tested on S4810.

Change-Id: I476333368dde1302c1b41cf1b9b3f4d43581edd5

commit_message:
Add delete_port support

This patch adds delete_port_postcommit support to:
  * cisco
  * arista
  * ovs

Change-Id: Ic019baf2a50f0d2021e77e442ceb00a0d793ae43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch refs/changes/44/369544/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port = context.current binding_profile = port['binding:profile'] local_link_information = binding_profile.get('local_link_information') vnic_type = port['binding:vnic_type'] if vnic_type == 'baremetal' and local_link_information: switch_info = local_link_information[0].get('switch_info') if switch_info not in self.switches: return port_id = local_link_information[0].get('port_id') network = context.network.current segmentation_id = network['provider:segmentation_id'] # If segmentation ID is None, set vlan 1 if not segmentation_id: segmentation_id = '1' LOG.debug("Deleting port {port} on {switch_info} from vlan: " "{segmentation_id}".format( port=port_id, switch_info=switch_info, segmentation_id=segmentation_id)) self.switches[switch_info].delete_port(port_id, segmentation_id)

subject: Enable 'text' format sort for enterprise databases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-11 07:12:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/bfad9e65c1ab09acfac6bb23899796f3306e547b', 'message': "Enable 'text' format sort for enterprise databases

For some enterprise relational databases, such as db2, the 'text' column in database can not be used in 'ORDER BY' sql commands. These columns need to be transformed and casted to the sortable variables when facing these specific databases, while for the databases that support 'text' such as mysql, this cast will not be done. That means the 'CAST' is only desired for those backends which require it, and it will not break the default mysql path.
The 'last_error' and 'maintainence_reason' in table nodes should be transformed and casted to the sortable text format when using as the sort key for these enterprise relational databases.
I did the testing both in mysql and db2 env, works fine.

Change-Id: I384b0a7755e6ef7fa874a44b5f551877732a9512
Closes-Bug: #1446508
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-11 07:15:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/3804588d37fe9f12ddc0c6702aa4e276486e3461', 'message': "Enable 'text' format sort for enterprise databases

databases, while for the databases that support 'text'
such as mysql, this cast will not be done. That means the
'CAST' is only desired for those backends which require it,
and it will not break the default mysql path.

The 'last_error' and 'maintainence_reason' in table nodes
should be transformed and casted to the sortable text format
when using as the sort key for these enterprise relational
databases.

I did the testing both in mysql and db2 env, works fine.

Change-Id: I384b0a7755e6ef7fa874a44b5f551877732a9512
Closes-Bug: #1446508

commit_message:
Enable 'text' format sort for enterprise databases

For some enterprise relational databases, such as db2, the
'text' column in database can not be used in 'ORDER BY' sql
commands. These columns need to be transformed and casted
to the sortable variables when facing these specific
databases, while for the databases that support 'text'
such as mysql, this cast will not be done. That means the
'CAST' is only desired for those backends which require it,
and it will not break the default mysql path.

The 'last_error' and 'maintainence_reason' in table nodes
should be transformed and casted to the sortable text format
when using as the sort key for these enterprise relational
databases.

I did the testing both in mysql and db2 env, works fine.

Change-Id: I384b0a7755e6ef7fa874a44b5f551877732a9512
Closes-Bug: #1446508

commit_message:
Add keyring support

This patchset adds keyring support to ironic client. Currently,
the user has to expose the password either through the command
line or by configuring an environment setting so that the
password is not prompted on every command. Adding the keyring
support will help in secure storage of the password and avoid
prompting the password every time.

Closes-Bug: #1490674
Change-Id: I4f857650da573eb7423fda1509c02652e20f114d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/32/218132/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import strutilsHAS_KEYRING = False all_errors = ValueError try: import keyring HAS_KEYRING = True except ImportError: passclass SecretsHelper(object): def __init__(self, args): self.args = args self.key = None self._password = None def _validate_string(self, text): if text is None or len(text) == 0: return False return True def _make_key(self): if self.key is not None: return self.key keys = [ self.args.os_auth_url, self.args.os_project_id, self.args.os_username, self.args.os_region_name, self.args.os_endpoint_type, self.args.os_service_type, ] for (index, key) in enumerate(keys): if key is None: keys[index] = '?' else: keys[index] = str(keys[index]) self.key = "/".join(keys) return self.key def _prompt_password(self, verify=True): pw = None if hasattr(sys.stdin, 'isatty') and sys.stdin.isatty(): # Check for Ctl-D try: while True: pw1 = getpass.getpass('OS Password: ') if verify: pw2 = getpass.getpass('Please verify: ') else: pw2 = pw1 if pw1 == pw2 and self._validate_string(pw1): pw = pw1 break except EOFError: pass return pw def save(self, auth_token, ironic_url): if not HAS_KEYRING or not self.args.os_cache: return if not all([ironic_url, auth_token]): raise ValueError(_("Unable to save empty management url/auth " "token")) value = "|".join([str(auth_token), str(ironic_url)]) keyring.set_password("ironicclient_auth", self._make_key(), value) def clear(self): try: keyring.delete_password("ironicclient_auth", self._make_key()) except keyring.errors.PasswordDeleteError: pass @property def password(self): # Cache password so we prompt user at most once if self._password: pass elif self._validate_string(self.args.os_password): self._password = self.args.os_password else: verify_pass = strutils.bool_from_string( cliutils.env("OS_VERIFY_PASSWORD", default=False), True) self._password = self._prompt_password(verify_pass) if not self._password: raise exc.CommandError( 'Expecting a password provided via either ' '--os-password, env[OS_PASSWORD], or ' 'prompted response') return self._password @property def ironic_url(self): if not HAS_KEYRING or not self.args.os_cache: return None ironic_url = None try: block = keyring.get_password('ironicclient_auth', self._make_key()) if block: _token, ironic_url = block.split('|', 1) except all_errors: pass return ironic_url @property def auth_token(self): # Now is where it gets complicated since we # want to look into the keyring module, if it # exists and see if anything was provided in that # file that we can use. if not HAS_KEYRING or not self.args.os_cache: return None token = None try: block = keyring.get_password('ironicclient_auth', self._make_key()) if block: token, _ironic_url = block.split('|', 1) except all_errors: pass return token parser.add_argument( '--os-cache', default=strutils.bool_from_string( cliutils.env('OS_CACHE', default=False), True), action='store_true', help=_("Use the auth token cache. Defaults to False if " "env[OS_CACHE] is not set.")) helper = SecretsHelper(args) if not args.os_auth_token: args.os_auth_token = helper.auth_token if not (args.ironic_url or args.os_endpoint): args.ironic_url = helper.ironic_url args.os_password = helper.password auth_headers = keystone_session.get_auth_headers(keystone_auth) auth_token = auth_headers.get('X-Auth-Token') if not endpoint: svc_type = args.os_service_type or 'baremetal' helper.save(auth_token, endpoint) helper.clear()

subject: Ironic conductor to honor the interval values for periodic tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 18:15:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/17b11ee75e21111e5da05b8c6b7c1a497177a24d', 'message': 'Ironic conductor to honor the interval values for periodic tasks

This patch is fixing a problem which was preventing Ironic from honoring
the interval values configuration for the periodic tasks. Since the
interval values are passed to a decorator they configuration options
should be evaluated prior to importing the module which contains the
periodic tasks.

In our case this is not happening because there's a chain of imports going
from ironic.cmd.conductor -> ironic.common.service -> ironic.api.app
-> ... -> ironic.conductor.manager which is making the @periodic
decorators to be evaluated before the configuration options.

To fix this problem this patch is simply reloading the
ironic.conductor.manager module again before we instantiate the
ConductorManager class. It would be possible to just remove the
"ironic.api.app" import from the begging of the "ironic.common.service"
file and import it inside the function it's being used but, that would
be a "flaky" fix and the error same problem could sneak in again while
we change those related files (this is a hard bug to capture with tests
in general).

A FIXME note was left in the code as well pointing to a RFE in futurist
which will help us to solve this problem in a more elegant way in the
future.

Closes-Bug: #1562258
Change-Id: I16c6e5a9ed0879b9b5f3949ffc4b0d58c67a97fa

-> ... -> ironic.conductor.manager which is making the @periodic
decorators to be evaluated before the configuration options.

This patch breaks that chain of imports by importing ironic.api.app inside
the scope it's being instead of the beginning of the file. We also add an
assert statement as a safeguard to guarantee that ironic.conductor.manager
is not loaded earlier in the startup of the process and prevent similar
