commit_message:
Ensure there are fdb_entries before iterating

_get_agent_fdb may return None so we need to check for
that before we try to iterate over a key inside of it
in delete_port_postcommit.

Closes-Bug: #1622996
Change-Id: I2256df0e08380e550f32248fb9589ee43b0923ff

commit_message:
Fix alarmdef edit screen

The alarm def edit screen is currently failing for some
basic / common alarm defs that are valid.  Since there are
many complex expressions supported, removing the validation
in the UI until a better validation method can be added.

Closes-Bug: #1599027
Change-Id: Ie873b68641dc8b7d0b871a1a6a66d30f92eb19fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ui refs/changes/80/368980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I73bfecbb13558ad68d233e8153d2ce89d37a57d3

commit_message:
Tony Breeds Stable branch maintenance candidacy for Ocata

Change-Id: I73bfecbb13558ad68d233e8153d2ce89d37a57d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/51/369151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I'd like to continue to serve as the Stable branch maintenance PTL. The role for the Stable team has changed slightly in the last few cycles. As a result of tooling improvements made in the juno/kilo timeframes the stable gate has been more solid. This means that the stable team is able to look in slightly different areas. Here are some of the things on my TODO list for Stable branch maintenance - Work with project teams to understand how decisions taken on master will impact their stable branches. Specifically projects with a driver model. - Work with project teams to implement constraints support - Growing the project specific, and stable-maint teams - Re-establishing regular team meetings and presence in #openstack-stable - Producing tooling to aid projects teams, release managers and the stable team to keep stable branches current and released with a regular cadence - Producing tooling and procedures to help retire projects as required If the team and community will have me I'm happy to serve again.

added_lines: I'd like to continue to serve as the Stable branch maintenance PTL. The role for the Stable team has changed slightly in the last few cycles. As a result of tooling improvements made in the juno/kilo timeframes the stable gate has been more solid. This means that the stable team is able to look in slightly different areas. Here are some of the things on my TODO list for Stable branch maintenance - Work with project teams to understand how decisions taken on master will impact their stable branches. Specifically projects with a driver model. - Work with project teams to implement constraints support - Growing the project specific, and stable-maint teams - Re-establishing regular team meetings and presence in #openstack-stable - Producing tooling to aid projects teams, release managers and the stable team to keep stable branches current and released with a regular cadence - Producing tooling and procedures to help retire projects as required If the team and community will have me I'm happy to serve again.

commit_message:
Remove expression validation from UI

Expression validation available in UI
is not working well with compound
alarm expressions for action: Edit alarm definition.

Following commits removes that code and effectively
moves burden of such validation to the server side.

Closes-Bug: 1599027
Change-Id: If43ce287038724f3d39186c4b0209823a02757a6

commit_message:
Fixed method for checking that node needs redeploy

Because in-progress status has high priority in
mehtod Node.get_status, the status of node was not
recognized properly durring checking for redeploy.

Change-Id: I3e0ac97b02d25803b810950cda383c220611c309
Closes-Bug: 1622972

Adding Alexandre Levine candidacy for Ec2-Api

Change-Id: Ifef5cb554a7c5ad6428e1552a44bab6cd13e4a92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/67/365467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi all, I am the current PTL for the EC2 API project and I'm the one who drove its implementation and adoption as a standalone project (previously it was a part of nova). I would like to nominate myself as a PTL for the next cycle. Last cycle we tried to keep up with the changes in Amazon and to contribute necessary additions to nova so that we can support some of the lacking features. The last part didn't succeed so we'll try again. The next cycle we'll try to: 1. Again submit required changes to nova. 2. Fix bugs and support clients. 3. Consider implementation of some marginal features which we do not support yet. Best regards, Alex Levine

commit_message:
Adding Antoine Cabot candidacy for Watcher

Change-Id: I78b9a2431f8ef2b37813e1d12e68e31fc8a8d785
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/67/369267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy to continue as Watcher PTL for the Ocata release. During the Newton cycle, our main achievement was to enter the OpenStack big tent by demonstrating a great diversity of contributors and the added-value of an infrastructure optimization service for OpenStack. With around 20 active contributors during the cycle and 15 blueprints implemented, I'm very proud to lead this project and welcome new contributors every week. Given that the Ocata development window is shorter, my main goal for Ocata is to focus on the stability and usability of Watcher. We also need to provide more optimization strategies that will demonstrate the capabilities of Watcher. Additionaly, I plan to work with Nova on placement API used for scheduling decisions. I would also like to take this opportunity to thank all members of the OpenStack community who helped our team during the Newton cycle. Thank you, Antoine

commit_message:
Allow vdu (VM) names to be specified as a parameter

Adding support to accept name property in the VDU TOSCA node type
which will be passed to Heat to create the VM with this specific name.

Closes-bug: 1570557

subject: Remove *openstack/common* in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 02:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin-dashboard/commit/f772ee2a1394ee7b31fbfd5e2ebebbae0a0a0c8a', 'message': "Remove *openstack/common* in tox.ini

The *openstack/common* was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
but oslo-incubator was ignore in oslo3.11.0. So I think we needn't
use it any more. Here is the oslo.utils CHANGES link:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/history.html

Change-Id: Ic7825ce7461f50ea64677fcb64cff6045dd88048
"}]
commit_message:
Remove *openstack/common* in tox.ini

The *openstack/common* was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
but oslo-incubator was ignore in oslo3.11.0. So I think we needn't
use it any more. Here is the oslo.utils CHANGES link:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/history.html

Change-Id: Ic7825ce7461f50ea64677fcb64cff6045dd88048

commit_message:
py3: Miscellaneous fixes

* Use base64 from oslo_serialization
* Use six.BytesIO instead of StringIO
* Use sys.maxsize instead of sys.maxint
* Use sorted with a key argument to sort by
* Use range instead of moves.xrange or xrange
* Use floor division instead of float division
* Use 'r+' to open a file than 'rw'
* Use six.int2byte instead of chr
* Stop using conn.strict in response_class()
* Tests: Only compare length for bytes, not assertRegex

These changes are tested here: I3a1dfde76009cbac1d419e0ff3f1d20c4a2e99c3

Change-Id: Iab9c23e497956e45c5d04a3d6513acf1b026aafb

subject: Add ability to use overcloud-full.qcow2 for undercloud image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 12:30:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/7f9fa143695ae8774a9037356ceea110dd468546', 'message': 'POC DO NOT MERGE Use overcloud-full.qcow2 for undercloud image.

This is a proof of concept showing how we could use an overcloud-full.qcow2
for our undercloud image instead of building one up. It is particularly
useful for the "devmode" case where we want to use content generated from
tripleo-ci, but where there is not an undercloud image.

This would also solve a cause of major headaches in RDO, being that our image
building process has drifted from the upstream process because of optimizations
to build the undercloud.qcow2. However, if we build an overcloud-full.qcow2
according to the upstream documented process and only convert it to an
undercloud, it is much harder to drift. (We would only do it in the conversion
script which should be very light)

This is a bit messy, and does not include any new flag for this behavior, but
it does work as is. Before merging we would want to make the behavior
configurable and defaulted off except in the devmode config.

Change-Id: Ib6b0e3beb41bd140c1bd327c994fb4c805ae3022
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-12 15:19:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/9b881a79f50096991ed14c5347ae576ec876cf52', 'message': 'Add ability to use overcloud-full.qcow2 for undercloud image

This change adds a "overcloud_as_undercloud" boolean configuration
option which defaults to false, and is set to true in the devmode
configuration file.

When this option is set to true, the undercloud image is not used.
Instead, the overcloud-full.qcow2 is converted into a suitable
undercloud image.

The libvirt/setup/undercloud role is also cleaned up a bit as
part of this change.

commit_message:
Add ability to use overcloud-full.qcow2 for undercloud image

This change adds a "overcloud_as_undercloud" boolean configuration
option which defaults to false, and is set to true in the devmode
configuration file.

When this option is set to true, the undercloud image is not used.
Instead, the overcloud-full.qcow2 is converted into a suitable
undercloud image.

The libvirt/setup/undercloud role is also cleaned up a bit as
part of this change.

Change-Id: Ib6b0e3beb41bd140c1bd327c994fb4c805ae3022

commit_message:
Allow to update resource-type (add attributes)

This change allows to patch a resource type.

The patch payload format is the RFC6902.

For now, only operation add on /attributes path is allowed.

Partial-Bug: #1615077

Change-Id: Ia88396dbe771f916f9e72d7072caa03d30a8e693

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Add updating resource type states Revision ID: 27d2a1d205ff Revises: 7e6f9d542f8b Create Date: 2016-08-31 14:05:34.316496 """ from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '27d2a1d205ff' down_revision = '7e6f9d542f8b' branch_labels = None depends_on = None def upgrade(): op.alter_column('resource_type', 'resource_type_state_enum', type_=sa.Enum("active", "creating", "creation_error", "deleting", "deletion_error", "updating", "updating_error", name="resource_type_state_enum"), nullable=False, server_default="creating") # NOTE(sileht): postgresql have a builtin ENUM type, so # just altering the column won't works. # https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/issues/270/altering-enum-type # Does it break offline migration because we use get_bind() ? # NOTE(luogangyi): since we cannot use 'ALTER TYPE' in transaction, # we split the 'ALTER TYPE' operation into several steps. bind = op.get_bind() if bind and bind.engine.name == "postgresql": op.execute("ALTER TYPE resource_type_state_enum RENAME TO \ old_resource_type_state_enum") op.execute("CREATE TYPE resource_type_state_enum AS ENUM \ ('active', 'creating', \ 'creation_error', 'deleting', \ 'deletion_error', 'updating', \ 'updating_error')") op.execute("ALTER TABLE resource_type ALTER COLUMN type TYPE \ resource_type_state_enum USING \ type::text::resource_type_state_enum") op.execute("DROP TYPE old_resource_type_state_enum")

Disable cache

this change after the next current-tripleo promote.

subject: Reorder item actions for cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 06:39:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum-ui/commit/9ab0986adc11dc175bed1c413c1eabce093f8b12', 'message': "Reorder item actions for cluster

Since 'Delete Cluster' action is danger, so we should
change order of item actions from the point of UX.

Now:
- 'Delete Cluster'
- 'Show Certificate'
- 'Sign Certificate'

After:
- 'Show Certificate'
- 'Sign Certificate'
- 'Delete Cluster'

commit_message:
Reorder item actions for cluster

Since 'Delete Cluster' action is danger, so we should
change order of item actions from the point of UX.

Now:
- 'Delete Cluster'
- 'Show Certificate'
- 'Sign Certificate'

After:
- 'Show Certificate'
- 'Sign Certificate'
- 'Delete Cluster'

Change-Id: I8deb6ad6ec371d5a04c690aa3abc53499fb8324b

commit_message:
Fix consuming from missing queues

Redeclare queues on 'Basic.consume: (404) no queue' exception
and enable by default consumer declaration with nowait=False
in order to wait for a broker response.

Change-Id: I99f2bc858dbc7c18a2f328ee26f39105ed17cee3
Closes-Bug: #1581148

commit_message:
Improve cluster extensions handlers

There handlers available under api/v1/clusters/{id}/extensions

* Re-work GET handler. Since now it's possible to enable extensions
  in more granular way which doesn't affect already enabled
  extensions.
* Add DELETE handler. Accepts comma separated list of extension
  names to disable via query string under 'extension_names' param.

Change-Id: Idd5680b489b4003bb2f58b5279a7257a128cc4e1
Related-Bug: #1614526

added_lines: def remove_extensions_from_object(obj, extensions_names): obj.extensions = list(set(obj.extensions) - set(extensions_names)) db().flush() def update_extensions_for_object(obj, extensions_names): obj.extensions = list(set(obj.extensions + extensions_names))

commit_message:
Use "cluster" and "cluster_template" of magnumclient

This patch changes "bay" and "baymodel" of magnumclient to
"cluster" and "cluster_template", as last change for renaming
bay to cluster.

Change-Id: I77b6dc02738a1c455274bdb34bddcc91e21a30cb
Implements: blueprint rename-bay-to-cluster

commit_message:
Tune workers and thread defaults for better performance

Similar to how we do in devstack gate calculate the workers on the fly
instead of defaulting to 1. Also limit the number the threads to a more
conservative number. We can override this based on the need.

Change-Id: I102f8f73fed997133dc8ecabbc95deca94627a05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-gnocchi refs/changes/24/368124/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Optional. Defaults to max(($::processorcount +0)/4, 2) $workers = max(($::processorcount +0)/4, 2),

subject: Rollback port after failed to add it to router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 10:57:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0323fe97e33749962fedd61abcccfcf2bc7a12f9', 'message': "Rollback port after failed to add it to router

After failed to add port to router, we cannot re-use and/or delete
this port. Because Neutron updates port's information (device_id
and device_owner) before adding it to router.

This patch will catch any exception when adding interface by port
to router. After that, it rollbacks this port to original state.

The partial bug will be fixed after
I476d3e03c8ee763cc4be6d679fe9f501eb3a19b5 has merged.

Change-Id: Ib68aee164a3062648fc882012d57b5e381f52196
Partial-Bug: #1535549
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 02:38:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a2be886b569aa5051c00d6a0bc512a17e4597a2e', 'message': 'Rollback port after failed to add it to router

After failed to add port to router, we cannot re-use and/or delete this
port. Because Neutron updates port's information (device_id and
device_owner) before adding it to router.

In ‘concurrent requests’ case, if a request had retried because of
StaleDataError, the port that I mentioned above will be in in-use state,
because the device_id of this port has changed in previous request.
So Neutron cannot add this port to router, then raising that: "...Port
already has an attached device..."

This patch will catch any exception when adding interface by port to
router. After that, it rollbacks this port to original state.

Change-Id: Ib68aee164a3062648fc882012d57b5e381f52196
Closes-Bug: #1535549'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-22 01:26:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/72e8fe75b01e6dd661594e512682478abc08c910', 'message': 'Rollback port after failed to add it to router

StaleDataError, the port that I mentioned above will be in in-use state,
because the device_id of this port has changed in previous request.
So Neutron cannot add this port to router, then raising that: "...Port
already has an attached device..."

This patch will catch any exception when adding interface by port to
router. After that, it rollbacks this port to original state.

Change-Id: Ib68aee164a3062648fc882012d57b5e381f52196
Closes-Bug: #1535549

accept one request, and other will be rejected by message
'...overlapped CIDR...'
The Kevin's patch[1] fixed the case of race condition, but neutron

commit_message:
Rollback port after failed to add it to router

After failed to add port to a router, we cannot re-use and/or delete
this port.

With concurrent requests occuring, neutron will accept one request
and the other will be rejected with an 'overlapped CIDR' message.
Patch [1] fixed the race condition, but neutron raises
'Port already has an attached device' instead of
'overlapped CIDR', because neutron didn't cleanup the port when
the request was retried.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/303966/

This patch is needed to fix the bug completely. We will catch any
exception when adding an interface by port to a router. After that,
we rollback this port to its original state.

Change-Id: Ib68aee164a3062648fc882012d57b5e381f52196
Closes-Bug: #1535549

commit_message:
Run identity-v3-only job on xenial

This is currently a >= newton job and is non voting so just shift it up
to xenial.

Change-Id: I529d4874305f0ffb5b61052caf3f0121b439a367

commit_message:
Now it is possible to fetch cluster own deployment tasks via API

/clusters/<CLUSTER_ID>/deployment_tasks/own/ handler is added that allows
to get cluster own  deployment tasks belonging to clusters attached
to the given cluster model directly.

Change-Id: I2c7afad9958a2453d48d2a70c164eb0269019041
Closes-Bug: #1605639
(cherry picked from commit 39d74ec7e4f491cac92bd759b17730c9cffe0133)

commit_message:
Enable X-Forwarded-Proto for manila

This is necessary so the middleware in manila can set the protocol
correctly in case we're terminating SSL in HAProxy.

Depends-On: Ice78b0abceb6a956bb8c1dc6212ee1b56b62b43f
Change-Id: Iedaabaf1379466c22e3b9bb2307e940459d26de7

commit_message:
Added functional test base

Functional cases can be described in yaml files in test/functional/cases folder
Each case will be converted into test. Examples of cases included

Change-Id: I60fc763c52ed4c25dfa7164c36c915497a430cfb

commit_message:
include instance_action manager in v2 client

the instance action APIs have existed for a while, and we'd like
to reference them in OpenStackClient. However, we only have access
to whatever is exposed in the client.

bp compute-action-list

OSC bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+spec/compute-action-list

Change-Id: I8cca4709c5e05c8530e3182e674149d7ffe4b7d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/40/369140/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from novaclient.v2.contrib import instance_action self.instance_actions = instance_action.InstanceActionManager(self)

commit_message:
[Docs] Add explanations about our bug triage process

This process was absent of our docs and should be included.

Change-Id: I3850180838d430feceeed94bae7158a6e35857e3
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/53/369053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The triaging process is explained on the `bug triage documentation`_ page... _bug triage documentation: bug-triage.html
deleted_lines: Triaging Bugs ------------- Reported bugs need prioritization, confirmation, and shouldn't go stale. If you care about OpenStack stability but aren't wanting to actively develop the roles and playbooks used within the OpenStack-Ansible project consider contributing in the area of bug triage, which helps immensely. The whole process is described in the OpenStack `Bug Triage Documentation`_... _Bug Triage Documentation: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#working-on-bugs
